Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by applying the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.1271 units. Part 2: Create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, tapering slightly towards the ends. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0093, 0.0, 0.1271]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7373. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D by applying the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. 6. Subtractively extrude the 2D sketch along the opposing normal direction with a depth of 0.1017 units.</description>
